channel.title: Year 3 | Your Data Science Mentor - Mohsen Davarynejad

item.title: Unlocking Entrepreneurial Success
item.description:
As you prepare to have a head start in your third year, where you’ll dive into exciting projects with real companies, there’s no better time to get inspired by someone who’s mastered the art of entrepreneurship. Steven Bartlett’s podcast on Spotify features a conversation with Marc Randolph, the former CEO of Netflix, and it’s packed with insights that could reshape how you approach your own projects.

Marc Randolph has been through the highs and lows of building a business from the ground up. In this podcast, he shares his journey and the tough lessons he’s learned along the way. One of his core beliefs? Every idea is bad—until you prove otherwise. This mindset is not just about being skeptical; it’s about understanding that success comes from testing, refining, and relentlessly improving your ideas.

Listening to this podcast will give you a fresh perspective on how to tackle the challenges you’ll face this year. It’s a must-hear for anyone serious about turning ideas into reality. Get ready to learn from one of the best, and start your year with the motivation to make your projects truly exceptional.

This is your Python free day. So enjoy it!
